com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface

Interface SurfaceScrollController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSurfaceScrollController

    public interface SurfaceScrollController
    A mechanism enabling a surface to request that its scrolled position (within a JScrollPane) be changed. This interface allows tools to advise scroll position changes to the JScrollPane (or other container) holding the surface. This enables changes to scale to intelligently "zoom in" on the area being scaled and for tools like the MagnifierTool to recenter the scroll position.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Rectangle getScrollRect()
      Gets the visible rectangle of the surface in the scroll pane's viewport, represented in scaled coordinates.
      void setScrollPosition(Point position)
      Sets the top-left position of the surface that appears in the viewport of the controlled JScrollPane.

    • Method Detail

      • setScrollPosition

        void setScrollPosition(Point position)
        Sets the top-left position of the surface that appears in the viewport of the controlled JScrollPane. This coordinate is specified in scaled dimensions (that is, the point (20,20) makes pixel (10,10) of the displayed surface visible in the top-left corner when scale is 2.0). Has no effect if the surface is not embedded in a JScrollPane managed by this surface controller.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the surface image to be displayed in the top-left corner of the viewport, in scaled dimensions.

      • getScrollRect

        Rectangle getScrollRect()
        Gets the visible rectangle of the surface in the scroll pane's viewport, represented in scaled coordinates. Returns an empty rectangle (0, 0, 0, 0) if this surface is not within a JScrollPane or is not being managed by this scroll controller.
        Returns:
        The visible rectangle of the scroll pane's view port.
